meanings.sent1: The movie's main character was unlikeable to many viewers due to his rude behavior.
meanings.sent2: The food had an unlikeable taste that made it hard to enjoy.
meanings.sent3: The unlikeable smell coming from the garbage can made everyone in the room wrinkle their noses.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky cast an unlikeable shadow over the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy fabric of the shirt was so unlikeable against my skin that I had to change.

meanings.definition: Not easy to like or get along with
meanings.sent1: The new student was unlikeable at first, but eventually, they warmed up to their classmates.
meanings.sent2: The grumpy old man was known for his unlikeable attitude towards everyone he met.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unlikeable nature, the boss always managed to make his employees laugh with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness made her as unlikeable as a rock in a stream, refusing to budge.
meanings.sent5: The cat's unlikeable behavior of knocking things off the table annoyed everyone in the house.
